text: Great spot for local delicacies that I've been frequenting for a long time. On this visit, I tried the location at Joo Koon during a trip to Decathlon. The place was just okay. The food didn’t taste as good as what I’m used to at Kent Ridge. The Milo dinosaur drink was watery, the iced lemon tea was too strong, and the coffee was cold. With no other options and kids with us, we had to eat there, even though it was already late for lunch. As it's a food chain, they should definitely look into improving the quality of their food.
The quality of the food can be better. My laksa tastes sweet and my toast one side is burnt, the other side is barely toasted.

bought a toast set, during the 30mins wait, only drink and toast is ready, i ask them for the eggs and they say another 15mins! end up changes to other bread again as i cant wait 45mins for 2 eggs! it was as if there are alot of people here.... next table say 2 drinks waited for 10mins... guess they are luckier than me

Meesiam and boat noodles were so horrible that we only took one mouth before we decided to walk over to Encik tan for lunch. When we cleared our food , we saw many other orders that were hardly touched at the tray return counter.

Good luck to the owner if they continue to have such horrible standard.

Can only give review based on my personal experience here on 27 Oct. Great beef brisket and the muslim staff with the headscarf was accommodating. I accidentally pressed takeaway unknowingly on the kiosk and maybe her instinct seeing my settling down with all my stuff on the table made her double checked if i really wanted to takeaway or dine in. Alas, her situational awareness had saved us all the hassle.
